intro: Cancrinia chrysocephala, commonly known as the golden-headed crinum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a golden center. The plant features strap-shaped leaves and produces showy, fragrant blooms that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value and unique appearance make it a notable species in horticulture.
